subject: AI
title: User Feedback Loops
description: Collecting and using real user feedback to improve AI.

hook.text: You add a thumbs up/down button to your AI chat. After a week, you have 3,000 ratings. Only 12% are thumbs down â€” but those 12% tell you exactly where the system fails.

buildup.text: Feedback loops: (1) Collect user ratings, (2) Log the query + response for rated interactions, (3) Analyze patterns in negative feedback, (4) Fix the issues, (5) Verify fixes with eval.

discovery.text: Negative feedback is gold: cluster the thumbs-down queries by topic and you'll find the specific areas where your system struggles. 'Most failures are about refund policy' â†’ fix the refund docs.

twist.text: Selection bias: users who leave feedback aren't representative. Angry users click thumbs down more often. Happy users just leave. Weight feedback with base rate adjustments.

climax.text: Build a weekly review process: pull the lowest-rated queries, analyze root causes, update the system, and verify with your eval set. This is continuous improvement.

punchline.text: Your users are your best evaluators. Give them a way to tell you what's broken.

quiz.question: What is the most actionable type of user feedback?
